Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Venice trip!”
Reviews.Author: jfiedler
Reviews.Content: All the great things said before are true. Breakfast included lunchmeat, scrambled and hard boiled eggs, 3 cereals, rolls and toast, yogurt, fruit--kept us full until late afternoon. Location is awesome, bed is really perfect, and staff is very helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: nbh
Reviews.Content: We loved this place -- had a room with a little room attached. Staff is great, breakfast is wonderful. Location is great. DON"T forget to bring the directions they send to you or you will not find this place! We forgot, and used "google maps" which didn't work -- we wandered around for an hour totally lost!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless.”
Reviews.Author: BrianMPowell
Reviews.Content: Little gem of a hotel in central Venice, halfway between the Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square; 4 mins walk to either. Set in a quiet courtyard away from the crowds. Clean, tidy, safe, beautiful rooms, superb breakfast, great coffee, free wi-fi, fantastic staff...I could go on. OK, so you don't get a room over the canal, but frankly you wouldn't want the noise and chaos of one of the those (or the smell). The Al Codega (the 'lamp-carrier') is the place to stay whether it is a romantic weekend away or a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CD_SoCal
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this hotel! The staff is very helpful and friendly, the location is great - close to the Rialto Bridge/Market and St. Mark's Square. Breakfast was just okay but the staff was very attentive. Internet is also free. Overall it was a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SarahKate88
Reviews.Content: While we needed a local to show us the way to the hotel, my partner and I were pleasantly surprised at the hotel with a free room upgrade on arrival. With clean rooms, very friendly staff, a great location and a wonderful breakfast, I would definitely stay here again. The close proximity to Venice's attractions was great, although we enjoyed getting lost thoroughly really seeing the city. Thanks for a great stay, hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jwestie78
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only had 1 night in Venice, and 1 night at Hotel Al Codega. However, I wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel again, if I am lucky enough to get to Venice again. We arrived early (about 10:30 am) but our room was ready and they allowed us to check in early. It is a little difficult to find (but it seems like most things in Venice are!), but once found, it is in a beautiful, quiet little courtyard area, and it is very close to all the main Venice attractions. The staff was very nice and helpful, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was nice with a great shower, and the breakfast was wonderful with a huge selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- helpful staff- quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple, stayed at Hotel Al Codega on March 9-11, 2012. The hotel was difficult to find, but we stopped along the way somewhere and they were very helpful in walking us to the location. It seems like most things are pretty difficult to find in Venice. The hotel room and restroom were very clean. The room had everything needed- they shower was very nice- with an above rain shower and a handheld shower head as well. We used the safe and had no issues. Out of the 3 hotels we stayed in Italy, this was by far the most quiet, which allowed for great sleep (much needed after long days). The location is perfect! We liked that it was sort of enclosed and not many people went that way, which is why it is a quiet place. We had no problems getting back to the hotel once we left it and were oriented where to go. It is still within walking distance to all the main attractions, but like I said, a little off the main paths, which allows for some quiet. The staff was very friendly. They made dinner reservations for us every night without a problem. They were very helpful in providing directions with their maps and were very accurate and simple directions. We had to leave very early in the morning to catch the train and asked if we could have some breakfast, since breakfast did not begin until 7:30 AM. They accomodated our request and even made some cafe for us in the morning. I would definitely recommend a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: DavidofNantwich
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at Hotel Al Codega and had a wonderful time. The room was superb overlooking the courtyard, the staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the breakfast exceptional. Having read earlier reviews about finding the hotel, we never had a problem and it's location between St Marks Square and the Rialto Bridge makes it an ideal base to explore Venice, Tea and coffee making facilities would be appreciated but we were aware that these are not generally provided in Italian hotels, so not a critisism.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: NJGuy230
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located making it easy to visit Rialto or San Marco ... an easy walk to either one. The place is quiet, clean, safe and convenient. I found the staff to be extremely helpful. I was there to photograph the 2012 Venice Carnevale and needed some assistance from the front desk .... you can see the results in photographs of "The Masks of Venice" posted on my website, @ www.johnreiterphoto.com Book this hotel, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTraveller62
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Al Codega. The staff was friendly and the hotel was nice. Close to the Rialto bridge and San Marco's square. Ask for a room facing the courtyard for a quiet night sleep. There is a DJ at Campo San Luca and you can hear the music at night. They do turn the music it down after 11:30pm. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable!”
Reviews.Author: IoanaNic
Reviews.Content: Al Codega was excellent in every way. It s very close to Rialto and San Marco(approx.5 min by foot),they provide a map which is very useful the first time,and after that its really easy to find. Our room(207) was beautifully decorated and spotless clean,quiet at night,the breakfast very good with lots of choices. The staff is very friendly and polite. All in all, it was the perfect choice for a beautiful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PrincessSparkleUk
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel easily, taking the ATVO bus from Treviso airport and then the Vaperetto from Pizzale Roma, although you will need to use the map provided by the hotel. The hotel is situated between the Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Square with both within a 5 minute walk. The room was large, clean and attractive, with more character than the standard generic hotel rooms you find in most hotels. The hotel isn't on the canal but is situated in a courtyard. This means it is very quiet and there was no sound at all from other guests in the hotel. There is no iron in the room as the hotel advises that it is illegal to have an ironing facility. Staff were all extremely friendly and courteous. The breakfast was excellent. A range of cereals, toast, pastries, fruit etc.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: lauren c
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took my parents to Venice for their 50th wedding anniversary in May and stayed at Hotel Al Codega for 4 nights. we chose it because it was central, therefore ideal for two older people, one of whom has lost all his toes and therefore cannot walk for very long without needing a rest! I had written to the hotel prior to our visit to let them know of my father's disability and diabetis, and they could not have been more helpful. My parents' room had disabled facilities and was located quite near the lift, and the management had purchased some suger-free jam for my father, as well as some sugar-free biscottes for him. The rest of the breakfast was also very good and there was plenty of choice. Dad was able to have eggs as well, and was quite impressed that the staff had labelled the pot of jam with his name! He felt very spoilt! The staff were very helpful in helping us find places to eat nearby and advising us about transport and attractions. They spoke French (great for my parents, who are French) and English (great for my husband, who doesn't speak French!). despite being very central the hotel was very quiet and we all slept very well at night.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and quiet Hotel in the center of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Blackmer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days and would like to point out the exceptionally helpful and friendly staff and owners of this family runned hotel. Our de lux room was perfect for a short stay and for a decent price too!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: JeroenSa
Reviews.Content: If I would visit Venice again, I would stay at Al Codega again. Perfect location, gorgeous (very romantic!) interior, exceptionally helpful and friendly staff, and all this for a decent price. I am a fan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Veneziano2012
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very nice stay in the Hotel Al Codega.Very good hotel,spacious room,booked a superior room,very quiet as it is located in a courtyard,very close to Piazza San Marco.Very good staff,commendations to Lorenzo at the check in counter,very polite and explains very well.The only little thing which might improve on is the breakfast,would have loved to get some nice sausages,otherwise very nice,super clean and rooms well kept and would definitely return back to the Hotel.10 ponts.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: KimmyRoSb
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for 3 nights in dec 2011 and we had a very nice time here. Hotel staff was very welcoming. Rooms were clean and tastefully arranged. Wi-Fi free in the hotel not only in the lobby. Very rich buffet Swedish breakfast!! Very close to Piazza San Marco!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: JMM0823
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early Nov. 2011. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was delicious and plenty of food. Clean and spacious room - even had a towel warmer in the bathroom. Great location between St. Mark's square and Rialto Bridge. Only issue was that wifi did not work in our room; we just used it in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sunki33
Reviews.Content: The hotel map is really handy to find the hotel, however we still got a little lost due to so many little streets. We arrived quite early and the staff was able to arrange for us an early check in. The room is decent size and clean with a well equipped and clean bathroom. The breakfast provided had a decent selection and the service was great, best to go a bit earlier as it gets a bit crowded later on. The hotel asks for the room key as you leave the hotel which can be a bit troublesome as you have to go to the reception everytime you go in and out. The hotel is convieniently located between Rialto Bridge and St Marks square so it's easy to get around to the main attractions. Overall, excellent service, excellent hotel, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ATG123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Al Codega for 2 nights at the begining of December 2011. This is a lovely little hotel situated in a quite courtyard between St Marks and the Rialto. We found it easy enough, probably due to being aware that it was difficult to find, but i found the map easy enough to follow from the St Marks dock of the Alilaguna. But will admit it probably isn't the easiest place to find. The staff were fantastic. Very welcoming and very helpful in suggesting places to eat and places to go, and nothing was too much bother, We had a late flight back and it wasn't a problem to leave our bags there. The rooms were very nice and had all you could need. Free Wi-fi in our room too. Bathroom has a great shower. Breakfast was included and plenty to have both sweet and savory. All in all, i would highly recommend this hotel, and should we visit Venice again, we would return here with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: bdahye
Reviews.Content: Was a little confusing to find, but once we got there the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were cosy (small but comfortable) and clean. We only stayed one night, but couldn't fault it

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and charming”
Reviews.Author: MrSnappit
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Hotel Al Codega and enjoyed the experience immensely. Tucked away in a courtyard between Rialto and St Mark's Square, it is a little challenging to find but the map directions provided by the hotel are excellent and there is access from the Rialto vaporetto stop without crossing a bridge (so ideal for wheeling a suitcase). Our welcome was warm and gracious, and the service we encountered throughout the stay was always helpful and friendly. Comfortable rooms and an excellent breakfast complement the overall charm, and an internet connection is available to guests. Overall, the Al Codega can be recommended without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden away hotel”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to Venice for many years and the accommodation can vary considerably. However, for the price, this hotel is good value and has one of the the best selections of food for breakfast.The staff are welcoming and very friendly. Nothing is too much trouble. Follow the hotels's directions carefully or follow a fellow reviewers directions which are pretty good as the hotel is tucked away. Nearest water bus stop, Rialto or San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Al Codega a hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: KatieVM
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights in Venice at the Hotel Al Codega. It is in a great location midway between Rialto Bridge and San Marco Sq. It is easy to cover most of the old part of the city by foot from this hotel. It is a bit difficult to find at first. Follow the hotel's directions closely. We arrived at the airport and took a water taxi which was a bit more expensive but well worth it for our group of 4. The taxi took us right up a small canal which brought us very close to the hotel indeed. Riding the vapretto would have worked but would not have dropped us nearly as close. The breakfast included with the room cost was very good. It was better than one normally finds in such situations. I would stay at this hotel again without question and recommend it to anyone looking for a smaller, more intimate experience in the heart of the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Janet645
Reviews.Content: The location, the staff, the breakfast, in fact everything was first class. We (a retired couple) have stayed many times in Venice, both in apartments and hotels and we can certainly recommend Al Codega. We were met at reception with pleasant smiles and greetings. The room was clean and comfortable and the breakfasts were very good indeed. All the staff were exceptionally helpful and we can find no fault. Please go and share our wonderful experience. Janet and John from Cheshire UK

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and freindly”
Reviews.Author: MTHEADHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel is difficult to find first time, but onec found it is very convenient and is very close to St Marks Square and the Rialto Bridge ( and the Hard Rock Cafe!). Staff were very helpful and only too pleased to help. Breakfast was excellent, lots of choice and greta coffee ! If ever visting Venice again would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “The Best Venice Stay Ever !”
Reviews.Author: LucaMT
Reviews.Content: Ok - I am very picky and fussy on Hotels. And the Al Codega has by far one of the best price / quality ratio I have ever encountered. Trust. Recently completely refurbished a couple of years ago. Split Center of town, right in between San Marco (5 min walk) and Rialto (5 min walk on the opposite side) Not immediate to find, but lovely Venetians will happily help you at all times. On the other hand, the Al Codega is nested in a little Campo (square) so cosy, so quiet and so charming that is well worth the few extra min it takes to find it. The whole building has been refurbished from outside to the inside. But... SERIOUS refurbishments - by which I mean to the slightest detail and to best standards. A few other positives: - service : 10/10 - clean: 10/10 - position: 10/10 - breakfast: 9/10 - presence of the owners: 10/10 I even wanted some fresh fruits for breakfast, and the wife of the owner Mrs Nelly immediately disappeared and came back with a basket of fresh fruits ! As I was pealing one apple, a maid appeared bringing me a little kitchen knife to make my pealing easier - without me asking ! - homily feeling: 10/10 - bed comfort: 9/10 - bathroom facilities: 9/10 - central heating / air cond: 10/10 - TV: 10/10 - Internet: free wireless all over the hotel and rooms with no crazy passwords required - Reception: 10/10 - Constant care of the premises, including all plants and flowers: 10/10 In all: the best stay in Venice. Exceeds the "4 stars" by far. Thank you to our hosts, Mrs Nelly and her husband and all the team. We will definitely be back every time we will get to Venice !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GillyFlower
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of October. Finding the hotel- easy to find if you follow the map on hotel's website Hotel- exceptionally clean, very helpful staff Rooms- not very spacious but clean and have everything you need- bathroom- we had a walk in shower. Great, Breakfast- good selection- hot and cold. We would definately recommend this hotel and will stay here when we return to Venice. Situated very near St Marks Square- so very convenient.for all the sights. (There are arrows on the walls showing the direction for St Marks Square and Rialto Bridge- so it's easy to find your way back to the hotel- well at least the general direction) There are lovely shops in Venice- I was surprised at how affordable the things are.TIP- if you see something -buy it! You find it hard to find the shop again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ++++++++”
Reviews.Author: burchett
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and can confirm this is an excellent hotel. Great location, "beyond great" staff, friendly feel. Venice being very crowded the rooms are slightly small but 5* accommodation. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toastandjam186346
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not cheap but not exorbitant either. It is very easy to find from the Rialto Bridge and close to the major sites. It is a very quiet hotel even though it is in the heart of Venice.Take the Allilaguna boat from the airport to Rialto Bridge. 25 euros for a return ticket. When you are returning make sure you get on at the Rialto early enough. The boat we took at 9:00am was full as it left the Rialto and there were other people waiting at four other stops for that boat and they couldn't get on as it was full. The rooms are quite dark and with the shutters closed you cannot hear anything outside or become aware of daylight. Handy if you are jet lagged and need to sleep. The breakfast is very pleasant, lovely bruschetta, cereals, fruit, bread, cheese and cold meats. The staff are very friendly and helpful and all speak English. The only downside was the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the room. I realise this may be a very British custom but it is a very welcome one when you find it available. When you first arrive at the hotel, it is nice to be able to make a drink while you rest up, when you get back from the day's sightseeing to rest before the evening out it would be nice to be able to relax with a tea or coffee; and it would be nice to be able to have a coffee as you wake up and are getting ready for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet haven in busy Venice”
Reviews.Author: Martine-Steve
Reviews.Content: A quiet hotel in a peaceful courtyard. Five minutes walk from the Rialto bridge and St. Marks Square. Staff all spoke excellent English and were very friendly. Rooms small but well designed and well equipped. Buffet breakfast was excellent and very tasty. Staff recommended lots of excellent local restaurants at a sensible price. Bar area cosy and a great place for a drink before heading out to dinner. The hotel also offered afternoon tea.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: alan f
Reviews.Content: Location perfect for easy walking around Venice for the day. Very well presented hotel. Staff were all friendly and helpful. The rooms were well appointed, very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included and very enjoyable. . Excellent hotel for a couple in the centre of venice for a few days. Not that easy to find, had to call the hotel and then no problem, had someone get us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located for a weekend treat!”
Reviews.Author: Bottlebrook
Reviews.Content: October 2011 - We spent 3 nights in Venice as a birthday treat and following a great deal of research, chose the Hotel Al Codega as it had excellent reviews and a high ranking in the Trip Advisor 'league table'. We read that some reviewers had reported difficulty in locating this hotel but we found the map on the hotel website to be very useful and were there within minutes of arriving by water bus at Rialto Bridge. It is well worth studying the map beforehand as the only access to the hotel is through a narrow alleyway which could be quite hard to find in the maze of narrow streets. The location of the hotel is, however, perfect and couldn't be more central, being only five minutes walk from St. Mark's Square in one direction or Rialto in the other. The staff were very welcoming and always ready to help or give advice if we needed it. We found our room to be very clean and comfortable with a well appointed bathroom, air conditioning and plenty of storage space. There is also a small safe and a mini bar as well as a television. The only downside was the complete lack of a view from our room which faced another building across a narrow ally, although some of the rooms were better positioned than ours and overlooked the courtyard. We didn't let this bother us though, as we only returned briefly in the late afternoon to get ready for our evening out. Continental breakfast is included and was just right to set us off on our busy days exploring this amazing city. Visitors now need to budget for the recently introduced Venice Tourist Tax, which is charged on a sliding scale according to hotel star rating and in the case of this four star hotel, adds 4 Euros per person per night to the bill. Although we had heard about this new tax before we went, we assumed it was incorporated in to the room rate and were a little surprised to be presented with an extra bill for 24 Euros on our departure. We had a fabulous weekend in Venice, taking in most of the major sights - many of which were within easy walking. So if location and quality is important to you, we would highly recommend the Hotel Al Codega.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable hotel - cannot be faulted!”
Reviews.Author: roddy_77
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel in a perfect location. The standout being the staff, with Elena (?) helping us with absolutely everything in the most friendliest and happy manner. Perfect. The bar was a great place to relax for a while with very reasonably priced drinks. The breakfast buffet was superb and the rooms, for which we received a complimentary upgrade, were absolutely beautiful and decorated in elegant Venetian style. Was easy to find using the map they provided in email confirmations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ReesWales_UK_
Reviews.Content: We paid for my parents to stay at Hotel Al Codega last week to celebrate their wedding anniversary.We'd stayed there last year and it was fantastic. Not only did my parents love it too, but the hotel went out of its way to look after them and make their stay extra special once they knew of their celebration. Thank you! This hotel has everything you want in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: NeeNee_Cho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 days during our trip in Venice, the advice from web says that this hotel is a bit difficult to be located. It was true as we got lost in finding the hotel but it is fun as we meant to get lost in Venice. The hotel is located in between Rialto Market and San Macro Square, perfect for tourist. The room is quite new and clean and just a bit small (still manageable for 2 of us). The front desk is very helpful and friendly who helping us to explain on the complicated Venice's map. Lastly, the great breakfast and coffee is surely made a great conclusion to our pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel al Codega”
Reviews.Author: rmscache
Reviews.Content: It is a little tricky to find, at first, but the Hotel al Codega is worth looking for! It is in a quiet courtyard so you aren't awakened by the bells of St Marks at 7 a.m. like we were in another hotel we had booked for the same trip... The staff is warm and friendly - very helpful - and our room was beautiful and very clean (something we also didn't find in the other hotel). The breakfast buffet was adequate. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to St. Marks in one direction and about a 2 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge in the other direction. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel (despite the prices)”
Reviews.Author: Persoglia
Reviews.Content: Location was great, service was excellent (the breakfast staff were fantastic!!) and the room was very clean however the room was ridiculously small! So small that I was forced to move our bed flush against the wall just so I could open my suitcase (we were asked by the porter if we wanted to leave part if our luggage in reception as it struggled to fit in the room). This is not my first visit to Venice thus I appreciate real-estate is a rare commodity however the size of our room was almost laughable (and would've been funny had I not paid close to US$300 a night). I've paid less for larger rooms in Venice. If this claimed to be a three star hotel I would be feeling ok, this is definitely not four star. You can book better, keep looking. The Persoglia's - Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  (Melbourne, Australia)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Phiddles
Reviews.Content: Really great location and the service and helpfulness could not be surpassed. Breakfast is continental and is exactly what you should expect and a big bonus in that the coffee - hmmm - really good! I was in room 205 and didn't hear a thing.. Very quiet. Value for money is very good when taking into account the price and location of other hotels in area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and excellent service and staff”
Reviews.Author: TATMA
Reviews.Content: Simply a wonderful experience at this hotel. Staff were extremely friendly and ready to help out with advice and made sure to attend to our every need. Location simply perfect just 3 minutes away from the beautiful piazza San Marco. Breakfast was good with cereals, yogurts, delicious bruschetta, fresh fruit, cheeses and scrambled eggs, croissants and pastries. Very clean / rooms include slippers and nice touch of extras (like toothbrushes and razor). They do not have a restaurant but they have a small bar area /sitting room where you could buy coffeee and other drinks which was great in the afternoon or after a night out. I cannot say it is a cheap hotel but it is definitely worth it and I strongly recommend. You have to try it - I can understand why it was rated the best from trip adviser reviews. About finding the hotel - not as bad as I thought but I can appreciate that at night it would be slightly more difficult. Given the reviews which stated that it was difficult to find this hotel - i made it a point to give you good tips to find hotel: Take Vaporetto 1 or 2 stop at Rialto (not Rialto Mercato) - As soon as you get down - turn immediately RIGHT and look out for the restaurant "ristorante Omnibus" and the restaurant called "Self Service" - they are near each other and you cannot miss them. "Self Service" is in a corner and you have to go through this alley (you will also see the sign Hotel La Commedia") if you look up. Walk this alley (1 minute) and you are in a small square - there are two small alleys in front of you. Choose the one in front of you giving on the LEFT. In this alley there is "Hotel serenissima" and at the end of it (30 seconds walk) in front of you you will see "Giorgio Armani Shop". Once you are in front of this shop - stop - On your left hand side there is the entrance of "Hotel Bonvecchiati" (very chic hotel) and on the RIGHT hand side there is another small alley. The Hotel Codega is through the right hand side alley - AND in front of you YOU WILL SEE AN ARCHWAY with the name SOTTO PORTEGO DE LA MALVASIA. Do not go under this archway!! Just 4 STEPS BEFORE THIS ARCHWAY "Malvasia" ON THE RIGHT HAND SIDE - you will see another archway with the name "SOTTO PORTEGO DEL FORNO VECCHIO - go through it and you HAVE ARRIVED. If you make sure that you keep on the lookout for the shops / hotel I mentioned you will find it. Also this is the only way to the hotel where you can avoid going over a bridge/steps which can be tricky if you are carrying luggage. Some other tips re good value restaurants: Two corners before the Rialto bridge there are two restaurants near each other which offer very good value meals: These are "Self service" and "Ristorante Omnibus" and are very near where the vaporetto stops. 1. This is in a corner with indoor and outdoor seating just on the canal . The restaurant is called "Self service " This is popular with locals and tourists because it offers a choice of pasta dishes and a main course and deserts for about Eur 15 including a drink. The portions are not small so with one tourist menu two people can eat easily. Try it . You can also choose one plate for about 6 euro. NOTE : This place does not open in the evening. It is open till about 5pm. 2. "Ristorante omnibus" This is just next door to the restaurant "self service" mentioned above.It offers a tourist menu for Eur 16 including starter/ main course and desert. Pasta is typically spaghetti with seafood or lasagne / main course typical veal milanese and/or fried seafood (octopus ,calamari etc). Note this restaurant does not stay open very late and closes at 9pm / 9.30pm. 3. Ristorante Beppino - On piazza san marco on the left hand side of the church - you will notice there are two lion monuments - once you are near these "lions" - on the right hand side there is a short side street and you find a street full of restaurants and souvenir shops. if you turn right - some 4 or 5 restaurants up - you will find this cosy restaurant with very friendly staff. They have a very nice menu and even the good value tourist menu (eur 15). In Venice it is interesting to note that if yu take the tourist menu they do not charge you cover charge or service charge but if you order from the a' la carte menu you are charged the service charge of (12% or 15%) and even a cover charge per person. So a plate of pasta (although very delicious) would end up costing you more than the tourist menu which would include pasta / main course and desert. So always look out the details on the menus carefully and then decide your preferred option. Trattoria Bella Vista - past the bridge of Sighs - just on the canal has very good pizza. Ristorante Noemi in one of side streets is also good. Avoid Ristorante San Marco which charged me Euro 5.50 for a cup of tea plus a cover charge of 1.50. Best to take the 3 day pass for the water buses than paying for each way. A visit to Burano (not Murano) is a must and you can use your water bus ticket to get there and no need to take the separate excursion to burano, murano and torcello (which would cost you more). Gondola trip is 80 Euros during the day and 100 euros at night- gondola takes 6 pax so cost can be split. Do not miss it. Venice is splendid ...so enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: 557EAnne
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel. The staff was fantastic and very helpful. Rooms were comfortable and it was nice to have air conditioning. We arrived by plane and took a water taxi to the hotel as had read reviews that it was hard to find. The water taxi dropped off us just around the corner from the hotel which was great... Very close to Saint Marco Square and also to the Rialto Bridge. Would definitely go back to this hotel if we returned to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abdan
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 4 day stay at this hotel which is only a short walk to San Marco Square and the Rialto Bridge in the heart of magical Venice. Beautiful room and bathroom, huge comfortable bed in this lovely hotel tucked down a little laneway. Buffet breakfast was very good and had a lot of variety and the reception staff and breakfast room staff are excellent and very helpful. Be prepared that you will get lost when you first try and find the hotel, even with the hotel map but that is part of the charm of this amazing place and when eating out, check that the restaurant does not charge a "table tax" as well as a 12% service charge. Would definitely highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there!!!”
Reviews.Author: lilianbrazilian
Reviews.Content: I just loved my staying at al codega!!! The hotel is modern for italian standards, the room is large and comfortable.... Is located is a small "village" right in the center of venice! A few meters from piazza san marco. Breakfast is ok (not the best ever but enough...i didnt like the juice), staff is awesome, specially Davi the brazilian guy. They offer free wifi connection....it doesnt work well inside the rooms but u can use a computer for guests in the lobby. Recommendation: dooooont take heavy luggage to venice! Al codega is 5 minutes walk from the vapporetto station but is difficult to carry ur stuff

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing staff and an even better location!!”
Reviews.Author: Prashant J
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at Al Codega at the end of August and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The rooms were nice and big and very tastefully decorated. The staff was approachable and extremely helpful. The breakfast buffet was ample and though their dining area looks like it is small, we never had a problem finding a place to sit for breakfast. It is literally a 5 minute walk from St. Mark's Square. The only drawback, if you can call it that is that the hotel doesn't serve food besides breakfast. So make sure that if you want eat something in the confines of your room (nicely airconditioned I may add - it was really hot and humid during the day in Venice) buy stuff beforehand. Also, its not so easy to find the hotel so print directions before you get to Venice. The closest ferry point is Rialto and its just a 5-10 minute walk to the hotel from there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Terrell N
Reviews.Content: Quiet, but near all the main attractions of Venice. Room couldn't have been nicer and seemed like it was new. Great staff. Only thing to do is to be certain you know exactly how to find it upon arrival or you will get lost. It is nestled in a courtyard off a short street that's very hard to find on a map. In the dark at 11:00 p.m. when I arrived, it took me a long time to locate it. After I located it, I couldn't have been more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good service & brilliant breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: suetlyn
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from Venice last night! We stayed at Hotel Al Codega during our 6 day visit in Venice and we can't be happier with our hotel room and the service provided by the staff of Hotel Al Codega. The location was excellent. It was literally 5 minutes away from Piazza San Marco. They have a 24 hour reception and they were very helpful in giving us tips and guidance on where to go and how to get there. Their breakfast consisted of juices, tea or coffee, cereal, cut fruit, ham and cured meat, cheeses, bread, croissant with ham & cheese, scrambled eggs... the breakfast selection and spread was really nice!!! A tip from us, please get directions to the hotel as it is quite difficult to get there if you're just trying to figure it out once you get to Venice by using the map provided by the waterbus operator! Otherwise, we had a perfectly WONDERFUL and enjoyable stay! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: MinK3
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here based on reviews we had read on Tripadvisor. We had already traveled through France & Switzerland and this was our first stop in Italy. When we arrived my husband realized he had not printed the map. We called and they gave us directions by phone & met us outside to help us in. Check in was a breeze. The room was spotless & in great condition. They were always very helpful when we asked about restaurants, gondola rides, etc.. The breakfast was was very good and had a variety of hot and cold foods. The only slight negative was the wi-fi. The days we were there were the hottest of the Summer so far and wi fi everywhere was spotty. When it did work the hotel did not charge us for it. The staff was always happy & polite. I will definitely stay here again. None of the other hotels we stayed at throughout Italy provided the same level of service as Hotel Al Codega.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming”
Reviews.Author: diopat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Al Codega after our 4 day stay at the Hilton Stucky. Dollar for dollar, we would stay at Al Codega if staying in Venice proper. The room was spacious and beautifully appointed. The staff welcomed us warmly, and served us coffee and cookies until out room was ready. Although we did arrive early for check-in, they rushed to get our room ready for us. This hotel is not on a canal, and a bit challenging to find the first time- but that is part of the fun in Venice! The other advantage of Al Codega is that being off the main thoroughfares it was quiet. Breakfast coffee and pastry was excellent. The short stay here was nothing but pleasant, and the hotel staff could not do enough to assist us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great people”
Reviews.Author: MTHEADHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here, slightly tricky to find, but hey worth it. Staff so helpful and room, breakfast and atmosphere were absolutely spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: valstewart557
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weekend nights in July 2011. While the hotel is a little difficult to find among the streets and alleyways of Venice, the search is worth the effort. The hotel is on a quiet courtyard festooned with flowers. Continental breakfast was the best we had in any of the five other hotels we've stayed at in Italy. Rooms are spacious, wonderfully air conditioned, and beautifully decorated. Staff was friendly and helpful. Even though I will never visit Venice again in the summer time (too many tourists, hot, etc.), this hotel was a welcome retreat at the end of an exhausting day. A little tip, take the #1 Vaparetto to the Rialto stop. It's a much shorter walk to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “an enjoyable stay while in Venice”
Reviews.Author: perducci
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Al Codega in October of 2010 during our first trip to Venice, and it was an enjoyable stay. The hotel is well located, between the Rialto Bridge and Saint Marks Square, and is situated inside a square... out of the way of regular foot traffic, which helps with noise.. Finding it was not the Herculean endeavor that it is frequently made out to be. Bring a copy of the map they send you and just look at the pictures other reviewers have posted of the entryway to the square and you should be fine. Took us 5 minutes to find it once we got off the Vapo at the Rialto stop. The staff were great, helping me by providing tips on gondola rates and nearby places to secure a ride, as well as suggesting a local restaurant where they would eat and even calling in to make our reservation. Half the staff were native English speakers and the Italian staff also spoke English very well, so no need to worry about any language barriers. The room was nicely decorated and larger than we anticipated. The bed was absurdly comfy. At least I assume it was. It was our fourth night in Europe and marked the first time I didn't wake up at 4am. Instead we (unintentionally) slept a full 12 hours our first night there... We had issues with no hot water the first morning, but that might have been a result of not waking until 11am. The house PC and internet connection were sub-par when compared against the other places we stayed while abroad. Finally, the place is a bit pricey compared against places we stayed, but this is Venice and pricey is a recurring theme. All in all the good really outweighed the minor quibbles we had. We would stay here again, if we wanted to stay in this section of Venice on our (eventual) return.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Spive
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, staff were welcoming and helpful. The breakfast area is quaint and the hotel location is central

Reviews.Title: “great great great”
Reviews.Author: almalik78
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights on our honeymoon trip to Austria and Italy. the location is great, just a few minutes walk from st. Marco's square and the rialto bridge. great large rooms with good air conditioning, a TV, a breakfast table, a large bathroom. very good service, the staff was happy to assist, when we came for a nap on our second day, they tidied the room up again after we left for dinner. breakfast is a nice buffet with good cheese, ham and great coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with great staff in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: bum_fluff1264
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location, 10 minute walk from both the Rialto bridge and St Marc's Square. It is slightly difficult to find, however the map on the website (the italian one), makes it very easy. The waterbuses run through the night which is very handy. The staff were extremely helpful and knowledgable. The breakfast room is rather small but fits most guests in nicely. Unfortunately they do not have a restaurant, but there is a small bar. The rooms were small but very cosy, the TV in the mirror is a novelty. We had a large shower cubicle but no bath which was disappointing. The bed was made from memory-foam which was very comfortable. The continential buffet breakfast was very nice. We had a view of a wall opposite with limited view of the sky, but let in plenty of light. However where the hotel is located I doubt there is a better view.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to find but worth it when we did”
Reviews.Author: LindaWolverhampton
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, comfortable bed, spotlessly clean with very friendly staff. Provided us with a snack and tea/coffee when we left at 7 am. Every member of staff we spoke to was friendly, polite and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is too difficult”
Reviews.Author: rosalee33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is surely not the most expensive with rates around $350/day for Venice but it lacks the attributes that would justify these prices. The internet is none existent for the most part, the hotel charges $12/24 hours and it is such a slow system that you need every bit of the time just to get on line. The staff blames either the wifi server in San Marco area or the platform you use to access the internet. The rooms are very nice but returning in the evening the odor of dead rodents is very prevalent. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - easy on the wallet”
Reviews.Author: DLRGA
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days at this hotel. It was not hard to find - we arrived by boat at San Marco square - when you enter the square turn to your left and walk to the arches. Take a right at the arches, go past the Hard Rock, over a bridge, and at the end of the shops, turn left and then another right into a small entry tunnel. The hotel is in front of you. We were given an upgrade at no extra charge. The room was very nice and clean and it is between San Marco and the Rialto bridge in a nice area of venice - close to everything. the breakfast is continental - so if you are expecting an American style breakfast, it isn't here. Breakfast was good - and included in the price. The room rate is reasonable as far as Venice hotel go. It is a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Convenient, Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Scribble96
Reviews.Content: Spent the last part of a 2 week visit to Italy at this wonderful hotel and we loved it. The hotel is fairly new (less than 5 years) and it's very close to St Mark's and the square. It is tucked away and you'll need a good sense of direction and a map to find it: but it's well worth it. The rooms were large and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was a good size and everything in our room was clean, modern and comfortable. The AC works very well (a bonus as Italy warms up) and breakfast was very nice every morning with a good variety of meats, cheeses, cereal and tasty sweets. The staff were extremely helpful and we felt very safe going in and out. There's even a nice lift (elevator) just in case you get in late and don't want to pound the stairs. We really liked this hotel and would stay again. Big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Pizzalover22333
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were all friendly and obliging. All spoke excellent English. Check-in was very fast and efficient. The room was well equipped and comfortable. The bathroom was well equipped for anyone who may have forgotten a few essentials. Television is built into the main mirror in the room. Choice of channels was a limited, as only CNN or BBC World in English. However, we did not go to Venice to watch TV! The location of the hotel is ideal, being only a short walk to St Marks Square and only a slightly longer walk to Rialto. Takes a bit of finding the hotel at first, as does everything in Venice until you get your bearings. Breakfast offered good variety. Wonderful experience in this magical city, further enhanced by this hotel. Although there were thousands of people in the more popular tourist areas, the atmosphere remained calm and relaxing. Would recommend buying a water bus ticket to cover your stay with ACTV, which offers great value and gives you great access to virtually everywhere, including the islands.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Joey-Luly
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Venice for 4 nights between Christmas and New Years Eve of 2010. In anticipation of our trip, we had read numerous reviews stating that the hotel was hard to find. Before we left on our trip we made sure to bring detailed directions to avoid getting lost in Venice's tiny streets. Well guess what? We still got lost. Even on the 4th night of us staying at the hotel, we still had difficulty finding it. But that is one of the things we liked about it -it was in a small courtyard slightly secluded from the millions of tourists walking around the busy Venice allies, yet only a 3 minute walk to St. Mark's Square. The hotel is not luxurious by any means but had everything that you could need. Our room was clean, comfortable, roomy (for European standards), and provided plenty of storage space, The staff was incredibly helpful. They made most of our dinner reservations as we chose small non-touristy restaurants and needed their assistance in making the reservations in Italian. The hotel also offered a small breakfast buffet which was a nice touch. We paid for the internet and had some difficulty getting service in our room. We literally had to be sitting at the edge of the bed to be able to get the internet to work. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A little treasure of a hotel; ticks all the boxes - location, service, comfort & cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Flick2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotal Al Godega forEaster 2011. My husband, adult daughter and myself in a family room - 402. Room clearly divided by archway into area with single bed and very spacious by Venice standards. Everything in good working order and well decorated. Unfortunately a family of mosquittos also thought it a great place to stay, so be warned!

Reviews.Title: “A gem.”
Reviews.Author: obt
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the positive things people have already said about Al Codega - it's a delightful hotel in an excellent location for a modest charge. But you do need your wits about you when arriving! We got off the Alilaguna boat from Marco Polo airport at Rialto; the red line on the map the hotel sends is misleading. The boat stops at the Line 1 jetty, which is marked on their map with a red blob to the LEFT of the two little bridges on the map. So you go straight down a narrow alley which leads into Calle dei Fabbri (marked on the map).

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden gem of a hotel, tourist hotel, but not 'touristy'”
Reviews.Author: H3KB4Y2K
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel using a number of travel websites, and were very happy with our stay there. $650 for 3 nights (Fri-Sat-Sun) in February. As other travellers said, it isn't easy to find, but the maps from the website are pretty good. If taking the alilaguna from Marco Polo, get off at the west end of San Marco, walk north. Pass the Hard Rock and the Gucci stores, make a left and you'll come upon the little doorway that enters the courtyard. It's close to everything, including San Marco, the Grand Canal, and Rialto- BUT it's off the main streets enough to be VERY quiet. It's important to be a clean hotel as well, and it certainly met my tough standards. Lastly, we had to leave at around 4 AM to meet the Alilaguna back to the airport, they were nice enough to provide a wake up call and whip up two cappucinos for us! Fantastic stay, friendly (and English speaking) staff. When we return to Venice, we won't waste any time trying to find a better place- we have found THE place, and we will stay at the Al Codega!

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: ted2304
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located down an alleyway in a courtyard. A littel difficult to find for 1st time visitors to Venice, but once you know where it is its great. Close to everything and all in walking distance. Bring walking shoes, a lot of stairs to climb in Venice hotel has elevator. The Staff all spoke english and were very helpful, they provided maps and recommendations. Nicely decorated and we liked the tv in the bureau mirror. They have a towel heater, view from room was another building but we weren't in room long enough to even look out windows.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: SKIpal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. So close to S Marcos but in a quiet little courtyard. It was really hard to find at first but once we established some landmarks we had no difficulty finding it again. The rooms are spacious and well appointed and although the hotel is relatively new the decor transports you to another era. I loved the "hidden" TV. The staff were friendly and helpful and the internet was relatively inexpensive. If I am fortunate to visit Venice again i would definitely stay here .

Reviews.Title: “Loved our break at this wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sycw_luv_2holiday
Reviews.Content: After going around in a couple of circles finding the hotel (no fault of the hotel map!) we were welcomed warmly by staff who showed us to our lovely room. It was very clean, very spacious and always quiet. The marble bathroom had the best shower I have ever been in! Breakfast was great, help yourself to as much as you like. Location was excellent, about 5 mins or less from St. Mark sq. Was just a fantastic haven in a quiet courtyard in a busy and very cold Venice, don't hesitate to book.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Small Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Globe58Trotter
Reviews.Content: Although a bit tricky to find inside the small square it is worth it. The hotel is immaculate and perfectly located a five minute walk from St. Mark's square or the Rialto Bridge. The check-in was very quick and efficient with a recommendation for a quick lunch as our rooms would not be ready until noon. The rooms werre spotless and well appointed, the bathroom in all marble was beautiful. No tub but a very large shower. I just wish that hotel's, in general, would have more places to hang things. We had the buffet breakfast and it was surprisingly varied. Get there early so you don't miss the chocolate croissants. Everyone was very helpful and eager to please. The only negative was a very expensive room service delivery of two cups of chamomile tea at night. This little hotel will not fail to please.

Reviews.Title: “All round unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: Laszlosz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights in this beautiful hotel in September 2010. Although it is only a 5 minute walk to St Mark's Square, it is very quiet. It's position is convenient to all the major sights and transport. The Hotel itself oozes charm and quality and this was enhanced by the helpful staff and delicious breakfasts. We spent a month in Europe, staying in carefully selected hotels - with the help of TripAdvisor - and Al Codega was the best of all. Staying there made our stay memorable and we would not hesitate to recommend Al Codega to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the center of the action on a quiet courtyard”
Reviews.Author: KRSTWO
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite nice and the staff was very helpful. The hotel itself was typically european; small with two twins cinched together and a nice, yet small, bathroom. The location was perfect for a first time visit to Venice - about halfway between St Mark's and the Rialto, with the Accademia bridge and museum close as well. With a proper map, you can find a traghetti (ferry) not too far away that will take you to S Polo in no time as well.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than expected!”
Reviews.Author: NNandCK
Reviews.Content: We truely enjoyed our one night stay in the hotel, wish we could stay longer!!! The rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable with warm atmosphere, totally suits the ambiance of the city! The breakfast was very nice, the only thing we missed was eggs/omelette, they only had hard boiled eggs... The receptionists were extremely friendly, kind and helpful. Regarding the location of the hotel, we can agree that the nice map which the hotel provides upon reservation is not completely accurate, since a lot of the small streets are not marked on it and it's quite hidden, but it is huge exageration that's it's impossible to find and very surprising that some fellow travellers spent 5 hours looking for it, the first local person we asked kindly showed us the way and after it was very easy to remember the way! We didn't have a very good sleep, couldn't figure out why though, because the bed was comfy and everything in the room was very pleasant, perhaps we left the a/c temperature too high, our fault. There is also a safe-box in the room which is a big convenience! We will definitely go back to this hotel in the most romantic city, with the best tiramisu you can find :-)!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quiet part of town”
Reviews.Author: jparker65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel al Codega for 3 nights in October 2010 and had a lovely time. The staff were super friendly and helpful, breakfast was good too. It was relatively easy to find given the limitations of getting around in Venice. The room was very quiet, the beds very comfortable and the room was quite large compared to other Italian hotels, although the bathroom was rather small. It may be a little overpriced though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kag&Co
Reviews.Content: I can't fail but to agree with the majority of other reviewers of this hotel - we had a wonderful 5-night stay. Rooms, staff, service, breakfast all excellent and no complaints. We tried the hotel internet, which is a reasonable price, but is unreliable - the only non-positive comment I can make about this holel. The hotel is situated right in the heart of Venice roughly equidistant to Rialto and San Marco but we were not disturbed by any noise. We found the hotel OK with the map supplied when coming from San Marco, but don't take the map too literally - the streets are not as straight as depicted! I personally think it is harder to find coming in from Rialto initially, but once found you soon get used to where it is. Venice is full of tourists with maps looking bewildered, but we found the best part of our stay (if you have time to spare) was getting lost. We discovered many hidden gems that way. Venice is expensive, no two ways about it. And the San Marco district, where this hotel is situated is the most expensive - the downside of being so central. For example, 2 pizzas and 2 glasses of beer will cost Â£30-35. It is difficult, if not impossible, to do Venice cheaply so if you are going to be counting the pennies rather than enjoying the view it is not the place to go. Avoid Piazza San Marco when the water is up - it is full of hundreds of people trying to get about on narrow boardwalks resulting in gridlock.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2thdrboyd
Reviews.Content: Very clean room with good central location, yet very quiet. We loved our stay for 3 nights

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but hard to find!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aliceantoine
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in al codega hotel; we spent 5 hours searching for it!!!! It is really in a quiet location! Itâ€™s a nice hotel, clean and quiet, very romantic, the rooms are so nice and clean, and the breakfast was good!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find but worth it”
Reviews.Author: rchiarelli6
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. A bit difficult to find, but when you get off the vaporetto at the Rialto Bridge stop, look for a porter (fachino). We found one, or rather he found us immediately. For 11 Euros he took all the bags and led us directly to the hotel. Well worth it for not having to trundle your bags over bridges AND trying to find this well hidden hotel. Five minutes to Piazza San Marco and/or Rialto Bridge. One computer in the lounge available to anyone for 2 Euros per hour, but internet service can be very slow and spotty.

Reviews.Title: “Do you like feeling welcomed by your hotel? Yes?... Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: snayyar
Reviews.Content: I had a drastically different experience than most reviewers. I am a planner and I vetted this hotel as much as possible. My research proved wrong - or at least wrong in our case. Venice can be tricky. It is difficult to navigate on foot. It is a challenge to distinguish authenticity in a sea of fake murano. And one must be vigilant not to get ripped off in a swarm of tourists. Alas, this is what we expect... and we love it nonetheless. Venice was our last stop on an 8 day tour of Italy with a group of 13 adults ranging from 22-65 years old. We booked 7 rooms at the hotel and were very pleased with the price (for Venice!) for a 4* and the prompt email with directions and map to the hotel. The hotel describes in great detail all the different ways you can find your hotel and how much it will cost. Print this out. You WILL get lost trying to find the hotel - but I suspect this is at most small hotels in Venice. So it was all in the charm :) The hotel is located in a courtyard, desperately needing an update, with small signage. Do not expect a grand hotel entrance. It's more like a side porch door. There is no one in front to assist with luggage or direct you to the nondescript door atop a staircase. Yes, the lobby is on the second floor. After dragging our 13 suitcases up a flight of stairs, we learned of the elevator on the first floor. After the climb, we found ourselves standing atop each other in the lobby. We are a nice group of people, mostly family.. but for some reason they were very suspicious at the get-go that we were trying to sneak people into the hotel. They asked for everyone's passport and we of course obliged. After 20 minutes the gentleman returned and had trouble finding a few of our passports. We left him to search - we had just been on a train for 3 hours and a water taxi for an hour - we were tired and hungry. I must say that the bellhop was wonderfully courteous and it was a glimmer of hope. That peace would not last long. Within a few minutes of sitting down in our rooms... a knock at each of our doors by the Front Desk. He was there to count how many people were in the room.I felt as if I was being lined-up for interrogation. Excuse me, but my 65-yr old parents are not trying to sneak someone into your lousy hotel! Please let them relax for a minute!!! After all they did just climb up all those stairs :) If you do take the elevator after returning from a relaxing evening stroll along the canals, don't think you can escape the BED CHECKS. The elevator is programmed to always stop at the 2nd floor lobby and the front desk stares deeply into the elevator, obviously counting its passengers. I felt like cattle. I felt unwelcome and I felt like going HOME :( We had to follow up about our passports - as it was not the font desk's priority. Later the Front Desk announced that they had found the missing passports - Oh happy day! He handed back a MALE's passport to my, very FEMALE, sister. He even insinuated that we had given him this other person's passport!! At the end of the day, the passports were found. But the stress was unneeded. The rooms are typically sized, but small, just needed an update. And In any other hotel it would have been tolerable, but with this level of service, the room felt inhospitable and I felt trapped in the small space. The bed was okay - the linens were acceptable. I did not feel comfortable during my stay. The bathroom was typically European but there was zero counterspace so my toiletries spent the stay laid out on a towel in the foyer floor. Classy! There was a breakfast room and it is included in the rate. My parents seemed to enjoy it. 1 Point for Codega. I will also mention that the hotel was properly cleaned - I got the feeling that the hotel is staffed with appropriately courteous and effective porters/housekeepers. I wanted to like this hotel. I really did - i thought it would be charming- but the cards were stacked high against me. STAY HERE....If you're going to explore Venice on a budget, and want an average hotel with poor service. Don't bring anyone here if your goal is to impress! In other news..... You MUST try a Bellini at Hilton Stucky sky bar. They are the finest I have ever tasted.... In fact, you should probably stay there. They seemed genuinely happy to have us and offered us a complimentary water taxi home, directions and HOSPITALITY!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: randstyr
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay at this hotel again if we ever get back to Venezia (hopefully!). The location was very good -- between Rialto Bridge and San Marco. The staff was always very pleasant, professional, and helpful. They gave great restaurant suggestions, and attended to any needs or questions we had. The room was nicely appointed and cleaned well. No problems with A/C, which we needed due the the hot temperatures we had at the time. The breakfast was very good as well. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Al Codega -- a gem not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: breeze_of_wind
Reviews.Content: There was so much to praise about the hotel -- I join others in noting its central location, superior staff, and great rooms. It is on a quiet side square -- a little hard to find at first -- but the solitude in this busy city is much to be praised. Staff were uniformly curtious and helpful -- they smiled, treated you as a valued guest, and made yoy fell welcomed. I really saw no down side to staying at Al Codega -- nor will you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lynn056
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in an ideal situation between St Marks and Rialto. Friendly staff and good food. Only complaint was we arrived in the pouring rain and still could not find it even with the map! .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeenBJ
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very central but tucked away in a lovely quiet courtyard (make sure you take the map the hotel supply when you book or you might never find it!). Not cheap but for Venice good value. Very well equipped rooms are a reasonable size, very nicely decorated and comfortable, especially the bed! Excellent service, very helpful and polite, pleasant staff. Some tea/coffee making facilities in the room would be a nice addition, maybe that's an Italian thing? Also pillows could be a bit more forgiving, but this is nit picking. Overall would highly recommend, and certainly consider going back again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “abolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: animal89
Reviews.Content: Al Codega was my first choice when looking for hotel in Venice however, I did go on to book a further 6 cancelling eachof them before I left on my holiday. I am so glad I did, as Al Codega was a lovely hotel to stay in. It's convenient, right between San Marco and the Rialto, great rooms, great breakfast and friendly staff. Loved it. Will be back to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary in 2 years time. Christine & David Walters, Swansea,Wales, UK

Reviews.Title: “Updated, convenient, friendly - a very nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFan
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. The staff is exceptional and Julie's recommendations on places to eat, directions and other suggestions were helpful. She is an American who has lived in Venice for 30 years. The breakfast is fresh and one of the best we've encountered in Europe. Not far from San Marco but still quiet, very accommodating and our room suited our family of 2 adults, a 3 year old and a one year old perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for a couple exploring Venice & the Veneto”
Reviews.Author: Stewart76
Reviews.Content: A clean, comfortable, quiet, well-run hotel five minutes walk from San Marco or the Canal Grande. Breakfast only, small lounge and bar. Friendly helpful knowledgeable staff with excellent English. Internet access works well but not free. Effective air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “A great disappointment, which ruined our Venice trip and made me lose alittle faith in tripadvisor reviews.”
Reviews.Author: ankitk13
Reviews.Content: If you're expecting a 4-star hotel, then reduce your level of expectations. The AC was not at all functional, and the power was fluctuating with no control. The Managers actually control the power from the lobby, creating unnecessary trips to ask for help at the lobby. If you're looking for a hotel experience avoid this place, as they do not treat you as guests, but instead as unwanted in-laws. This hotel cross-verifies each detail to ensure they're only providing you the service that you paid for, don't expect any mercy for additional services.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel! Awesome location! Friendly Staff! Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: Moojie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was smack bang in the middle of the Rialto and San Marco! This was my favourite hotel in all of Europe. The staff were so helpful and happy!!! The room was huge and very well presented! Bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was good. Awesome hotel in awesome location. Internet not free but very reasonably priced. Just brilliant!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodation for a perfect honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraButterworth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Al Codega. We arrived on the 8th August by vaporetto to Rialto (the cheapest form of travel - 25 euro return each - huge saving compared to taxi.) We enjoyed winding round the Venetian pathways - our first great impression of this glorious city remaining the same all week, and actually found the hotel without too much of a problem (getting slightly lost not posing a problem in a city whose treasures are best discovered by a bit of aimless wandering.) The desk clerk was very welcoming, producing a map with key features described, and we were shown to our room by a very friendly and helpful porter. The room was perfect for us - plenty of space, traditional Venetian decor, superb bathroom, well-stocked mini bar ( a bottle of Prosecco the first casualty...) and a view out to the street four floors below. For the entire stay, it was quiet, the air conditioning worked perfectly, and the room was cleaned/straightened twice a day without a feeling of intrusion. The breakfast was good - continental with enough variety - and with the friendly staff that seem to be the pride of this lovely hotel. I cannot understand the partially negative reviews read on this site - it's only a personal point of view but I do feel that people's obsessions with things like strength of signals for WiFi are puzzling given the nature of the beauty and history of this city - this is the perfect base to do what Venice is all about to us - walk, drift, and drink in the history and culture of this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful welcome to a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: aindyloves2travel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so welcoming from the moemnt we booked it. They emailed me twice with a map, directions, cost of travel from airport/train startions and distances and things to do and see in Venice. The hotel is located in a little square and we had no problem finding it as the map they emailed on was very detailed. The hotel is in a fantastic location, inbetween St. Mark's square and Rialto Bridge, and located near plenty of water bus stops, so even if you have alot of bagage you will have no problem reaching the hotel. The hotel staff were friendly and welcoming. One male receptionist in particular was really lovely and gave us lots of advice on where to go, where to eat and best place to get a reasonable gondola. The breakfast was really nice and the room was lovely, clean, comfortable and beautifully finished. Exactly what you need after a day wandering around Venice. I would definitley stay here again and recommend it friends. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent, but NOT 4 starts”
Reviews.Author: OnurWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three days during our trip. The hotel is decent, some pros and cons: Location is great (right near Rialto and about a 5 min. walk to San Marco), the rooms are impeccably clean and updated. The breakfast is pretty good. On the other hand the service, particularly at the front desk is not the best; the staff isn't very helpful with recommendations for restaurants, bars or attractions. When we asked which gondola service they recommended, the staff simply said to take any we see, without any further details. Similar attitude with other things like walking routes...etc. Our room was very small and looked out to the building next door. If you're just looking for lodging at a reasonable price, without needing help with sightseeing, restaurants and bars, go for it. Otherwise, go with another hotel that could actually be a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Al Codega is not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulSacramento
Reviews.Content: We were impressed when we arrived and greatly disappointed when we left. This hotel that has a "four star" rating has very nice rooms in a mostly quiet setting. The comments that say it is hard to find are true but can be said of most any place in Venezia. If you have to go, we suggest trying to google it's location from the Rialto bus/boat stop before you arrive. All tourists in Venice run around with tiny maps that are of little use due to tiny print. Find the Burger King/Armani store at Campo San Luca square and you are two turns away. The hotel itself presents very well. Clean, okay continental breakfast and nice sized rooms. Well decorated. Pleasant staff but short on customer service. Concerns about the Air Conditioning were met with seeming skepticism. About the AC - We spent two nights here. The first night in room 207. The AC, though set at 17C, did not cool the room at all. The reception at the desk was cooler than the room. "had we checked the windows?" The desk clerk checked his computer system which monitors the rooms and asked if we were going out. We left and came back hours later to a still hot, muggy room. The now new desk clerk asked the same questions. He did offer to change our room to room 406 and did bring a small bottle of champagne (nice gesture, but no thanks). We packed up (really a pain when youâ€™ve already unpacked) and changed rooms. The AC worked fair until the next day when it too stopped. This time the desk did nothing other than suggest keeping our window open for the night. It was hot and muggy outside and noisy. We slept in a hot muggy room sticking to the sheets. This hotel knows they have a troubled AC system. Upon checkout they offered a small, wrapped gift for our troubles. Thanks but no thanks. After sweating all night on sticky sheets the "gift" for our troubles should have been a reduced rate at the very least. Management that bills itself as four star and charged us 135 euro for the first night and 180 for the second (for no good reason given both nights were mid-week) and knows they have AC problems should treat their guests better. We also woke up the second day to no hot water. The wifi (we paid 6 euro for 24 hours) is also very, very weak and constantly dropped us in the room. The PC in the lobby was so-so as well. It has Skype on it but no microphone?? We really wanted to say this was a great experience. The hotel has a lot of potential. However, at this time, it operates no better than a two star hotel given the flaws given above. And even most two star hotels that advertise as having AC, hot water and wifi deliver these items. Especially when you pay for them all. Hotel Al Codega was like a pretty wrapped package that when you opened it you found the box was empty... We would suggest somewhere else for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, welcoming, and helpful”
Reviews.Author: bluegrassboy
Reviews.Content: First trip to Venice, and the staff at the hotel (Julie in particular) made it a wonderful experience with local sightseeing tips, directions, and restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for sights - nice and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Martin_and_Steggs
Reviews.Content: To echo what most other users have already said, this is a great reasonably priced hotel (for Venice). It is in a quiet square close to St Mark's and once you've found it, you'll have no trouble finding it again. If you get a taxi from the airport (as opposed to the Vaporetto), it drops you off at Testolini and it's straight on past Armani, take the first left and an immediate right through the alleyway (of which another user has already posted a photo). Rooms are a fair size, with a good firm bed, large bathroom and plenty of wardrobe space. TV is lacking in channels, but you don't go to Venice to watch the telly! Wifi is relatively cheap and the front desk are helpful and can recommend some good restaurants nearby. Breakfast is of a typical continental style, with meats, pastries and cereals and is not bad at all for free! Overall, you can't really go wrong in choosing Al Codega. One further point to make is that if you are prepared to pay for it, the food in Venice is of the highest class - however prepare for bills in excess of EUR 150 for two.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Gem Between St. Mark's and the Rialto Bridge”
Reviews.Author: MarkBearSF
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Al Codega. It's located almost exactly between the Piazza San Marcos and the Rialto Bridge, yet has only one small bridge to either location (this may be a consideration for luggage) The service was great and the continental breakfasts were very nice. Rooms are European-sized (smallish) but comfortable. A great location at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTraveller225
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights from 15th June after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. It proved to be a great choice of hotel - one we would certainly use again and would recommend to our friends. The room was well appointed with a separate toilet and bidet to the shower room, well stocked mini-bar and comfortable beds and with an amazing (to us) hidden tv behind a mirror. The room had three windows, all overlooking the narrow streets below, but with shutters closed and double glazed windows, it was very quiet during the night. Despite a recent review criticising the air conditioning, we had no trouble regulating ours to the desired temperature. There was ample to eat at breakfast with a good variety, albeit all cold food and the staff gave quick and pleasant service. Compared with most of the rest of the world, we found the price a little high considering the lack of amenities of the hotel - but this is Venice so one has to expect it. The hotel COULD be a little difficult to find, as other reviewers have stated, although we had no problem and walked straight to it within ten minutes of the the Rialto vaporetto stop, helped by the hotel's map and a photograph of the archway posted by a previous reviewer. Google Earth also helped! Using the hotel's map, from the Rialto stop, once you have crossed the canal bridge, carry straight on past the theatre on your right and turn left into Campo s. Luca. In front of you you will see Burger King. Walk down the left hand side of it and take the first right. The archway leading to the court yard and the hotel is a few metres on your right.

Reviews.Title: “Haven of tranquility!”
Reviews.Author: MuncherJ
Reviews.Content: Having read previous travellers problems regarding finding the hotel, we found it first time following the 'treasure island' type map emailed by the hotel. Location brilliant for main attractions. The reception staff were excellent. Nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was adequate. Value for money - brilliant. Would certain go back and recommend it to friends who want to see the wonderful sights of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “overly priced”
Reviews.Author: hongkong69
