Reviews.Content: i stayed 3 nights visiting venice on the week-end . i chose the al codega based on my trip advisor research and i regret because i paid 150â‚¬ per night while this hotel would not justify more than 100 even if it's venice, even if it's close to san marco. on a ridiculously cheap note, i found myself without air conditioning one morning because they control it individually to each room from the front desk. to spare electricity, they modulate and you end up in an uncomfortable situation without a/c because they decided your room temperature is ok (mine was 26 Â°C by the way as showing at the front desk). mean and very cheap manners...

Reviews.Title: “A to Z, a really great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: bravo-cinzia
Reviews.Content: Once you find this place, which is admittedly hard the first time, you will be happy you chose it. Minutes from the Rialto Bridge and San Marco, it is also just a 10 minute walk to the Accademia, so you really are in the middle of it all and can get anywhere easily. Notable is the fact that there is not a bridge to cross between the hotel and the Rialto in case you have anyone with you in a pram or wheelchair or who is unsteady on stairs. Great breakfasts with a lovely, knowledgeable and very helpful staff. Having experienced Italian breakfasts for many years, I am happy to report that this one is not the traditional Italian "sweet roll with coffee" that the entire country lives on. Fruits, yogurts, hard boiled eggs, cheese, meats, breads, croissants (both unsweet and also ones filled with apricot jam) cereals, and also some totally addictive fresh pastry. (Don't even try one unless you acknowledge that you will get addicted.) Another feature that I liked was that the breakfast room (along with hotel reception desk, by the way) is on the 2nd floor. I like having breakfast in a room with windows and light. Many Italian hotels' breakfast rooms are in dark nooks or even below ground; I know they have to put them where they have space but I don't have to love it. Another great feature was the book shelf centrally located in the breakfast area, right in the middle of everything! You can borrow, skim, peruse or research from the books there. And, you can also leave ones that you no longer need and lighten your load, to boot. Our room was spacious by Venice standards and very comfortable. Everything is new (the hotel itself, though in an old building, is also fairly new and it was well designed. The bedroom walls are covered in fabric above the chair rail, it's elegant and quiet. The drapes are lovely and have gorgeous tasseled tiebacks. The windows are also new and really keep out the street sounds if you are not in the mood for them. We slept great! We left windows open one night and enjoyed the airflow and the street sounds. Then we closed them after that when I got buzzed by a mosquito. Our bathroom was also new with a pretty red marble sink and a sunflower showerhead. The bathroom was on the small side but, hey! this is Venice and it worked quite well. (toilet compartment was separate so that more than one person did not have to squeeze in and share. We did not have a great view but we did have three windows which is something I like. Two of our windows looked out onto streets but they all were private and did not look in to other windows across the way. (or vice versa) In Venice, we don't spend much time in the room anyway because there is too, too much else to see and do! Our foolproof tip for finding this place is to keep in mind A to Z. (in this case, it stands for Armani to Zegna! really, Z to A, not A to Z) and it starts from San Marco. You can always get to San Marco from anywhere; it is the main attraction. Follow the street that runs along the left hand side of Piazza San Marco (as if you were looking at the square from the canal with the Basilica on your right.) You should be at the opposite end of the square from the Basilica and outside the arches that enclose the square and walk away from the direction of the canal with San Marco to your right. According to the map, the street's name is Ascensione but I never did find one sign. Walk as straight as you can; when you reach the Ermenegildo Zegna men's store in a minute, you are golden! Facing Zegna, make a small jog to the right around the Zegna store and continue as straight as possible, now along the canal. This is also the gondola basin parking area and it was beautiful to see them all lined up at any time of day or night. Walk for another minute or two. When you reach the Armani store, follow alongside to the end of the Armani building, and then turn left. The problem is that this is Venice; nothing looks as though it is actually a real street. Even rather main streets can be narrow, cramped and a little scary.) This looks narrow and cramped and a little scary and you can't see any hotel nor is there a sign. And, once you turn, it looks smaller and scarier, but proceed a bit further, looking toward the right for a portal in the wall. When you find the porteggio, turn right inside it, walk 20 feet and all of a sudden, you will find yourself inside a bright and spacious courtyard with a well. You will finally see the hotel. But wait! It still seems hard... where to go in? The entrance door is at the far rear right hand corner. So, cross the courtyard all the way to the back. Go up the staircase or, if you have baggage or if it's late and the staircase gate is locked, go to the door under the staircase that will lead to the elevator. The secret is that the hotel is on the inside of a secret courtyard, making it slightly hard to find, but so worthwhile! Also, it just does not have the look of a big city street. (because this is Venice, glorious Venice!) Once you figure it out, memorize the surrounding streets and you won't have the same problem. The courtyard is enclosed by Goldoni and Fuseri Streets... but be aware that one street over is Fabbri... Fabbri and Fuseri are easy to mix up! We walked up and down Fabbri once before we realized it was the wrong street. We used to stay somewhere else in Venice but Al Codega is now our choice for a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CostaRicaSue
Reviews.Content: While the Hotel Al Codega is a bit hard to find the first time, it is worth the search because it is a real oasis in the center of a bustling mass of tourists. Venice is magical and that is why everyone wants to go there. This hotel makes the stay a real treat. The service is very personal.....they even went to get pizza for us when we were tired and it was pouring rain.....and the staff is very friendly. The only slightly negative for us was some street noise at night (ask for an inside room) and some thumping sound in the night which no one could ever trace the source for. But, this was not enough to overshadow the loveliness of staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laney26
Reviews.Content: We cannot recommend this hotel enough! The staff we're all very friendly and welcoming, their service and attention to detail was excellent. The rooms we're spotlessly clean and very well decorated, and the breakfast was very good. Also the bed was really comfortable, which after a day of walking around Venice is a definite must have! The hotel is quite tricky to find, my husband had forgot the email showing the map (obviously his fault!!) and we couldn't get the vaporetto from the airport to Rialto and had to get off at San Marco as the Grand Canal was closed ...We arrived on the day of the rowing race (i'll admit not my husband's fault!!) After what felt like hours and the loss of a little male pride my hubby eventually gave in and we rang the hotel and within a couple of minutes they sent a member of staff to collect us - we had been walking around in circles and we were only around the corner! My tip would be to remember the plan the hotel provides with their welcome email!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Lynnette
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel! Very modern and our room was well-appoined. The location of this hotel cannot be beat- halfway between Rialto and San Marco and tucked into a quiet little courtyard. While it was a little tricky to find, so is pretty much everything in Venice and the hotel provided a good map on how to get there. If you get off the vaporetto at Rialto there is only one bridge to cross with your luggage- trust me, this is important! Breakfast was good and staff were pleasant and attentitve. We were very satisfied with our stay and will stay here again when we return (hopefully very soon :) !)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it..”
Reviews.Author: Jaclyn4482
Reviews.Content: We stayed last year 04/2009 and enjoyed the hotel and staff. It did take us awhile to find it. Ask for very specific directions (landmarks) ...the provided map is not adequate. If memory serves me correctly you will take the 2nd Rialto exit from the water taxi. The hotel entrance is a tight area but our room was lovely. The rooms are clean and spacious enough for my husband and I. One note...in an effort to conserve energy the power goes off when you leave the room. So we would come back to a dead laptop and stuffy room. The staff was accommodating in by passing that. Venice is beautiful. The weather last yr in early April was mild but very nice all through Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideNev
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 weeks in Europe & this was one of the best hotels we stayed in. The room was spacious, well appointed & very quiet. Although it is a little hard to find, it is very conveniently located, mid way between Saint Marks Square & the Rialto Bridge. Staff were very pleasant & the breakfast was more than adequate. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Gem”
Reviews.Author: IDFSNotts
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Venice are a bit of a lottery but with Al Cordiga you have won the lottery. Tucked away in a little courtyard (not the easiest place to find) it offers an exceptional location, almost midway between St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. Rooms are beautifully equipped and quiet. Reception staff could not be more helpful and the restaurant they recommended near Rialto Bridge was so good we went on two nights. Stunning food and service. The hotel owners are involved each day and the whole atmosphere is one of comfort, friendliness and service. What more could ask?!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay During a Tough Situation!”
Reviews.Author: mkjava
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Al Codega Hotel in Venice. We actually stayed 3 days longer than planned due to the volcano in Europe. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, considering that they were stuck with a hotel full of the same very-stressed guests for many extra days! The hotel is in a great location, close to everything. Breakfast was light but good and our room was very nice and a good value for the nightly rate. My only suggestion to the hotel would be to offer some additional English language TV channels, but all in all it was a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Paris57
Reviews.Content: I had a four-night stay in March 2010 and had a really great time. The hotel is well positioned but very, very difficult to find. The staff were all very helpful and polite and although the room was small it was extremely clean and more than adequate for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little place - great find.”
Reviews.Author: Sassy_Traveller_82
Reviews.Content: Al Codega is a very charming little hotel, tucked away in a quiet courtyard near San Marco. It is elegantly furnished, with attention to detail. The breakfast is also well presented. Having stayed in quite a few noisy and yet expensive Italian hotels before, we were very pleasantly surprised and most definitely recommend it. Do recommend wearing comfortable shoes on day of arrival, as it is quite hard to find!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spearmint
Reviews.Content: Lovely elegant cosy hotel. Quite near the Rialto bridge. No tea/coffee in the room. If like us we like a cuppa first thing. So need to take a small kettle. My continental plug ( flat pins ) did not work. You need round pins for sockets. Hotel reception will lend you one. If you leave the window open at night, we found it very noisy with tourists passing by shouting. So if you can shut the shutters and windows. Breakfast was continental. Enough to fill us up all day Cereal, fruit, yoghurt, ham, cheese, bread for toasting, croissants, cake, boiled eggs etc: Very easy to get from the airport by coach, and then the water taxi to Rialto bridge. All the ticket persons speak good English, and show you where to get everything. Would recommend a water taxi to Boran Island. Catch boat by St.Marks square, near bridge of sighs and Hotel Daniel. Absolutly beautiful. Lots of different coloured houses in small tucked away courtyards . Much cheaper to eat and drink there as well. We only had two days . Not enough time to see everything. Must go back. Can't wait. Gondole ride 80 euros, but if you look around you can get one for 75 euros. Thats per boat not per person.

Reviews.Title: “Delicious breakfast, cozy room”
Reviews.Author: multicoastal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is difficult to find at first--in a courtyard off a low alley--but that could be said of much in Venice. Our room was very nice but extremely small--I reserved a "Superior Double" online but the space didn't seem like what the picture had shown, so I'm not sure if I stayed in a Superior Double or a regular one. It didn't seem worth arguing about, however, as hotel rooms in Europe are usually smaller and the room felt luxurious and well-appointed. The people at the front desk were helpful in making restaurant reservations for us in Italian and the parlor had a good selection of Venice guidebooks. And breakfast was delicious and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldDiva
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time in Venice and when we couldn't get accommodation at our chosen hotel this time, we decided to try Hotel Al Codega. We went for a superior room and we were delighted with it. It was very large, very classy and very clean. We had an extremely comfy and large double bed and another day bed at the end of the room. The bathroom was a very good size with an excellent shower and was very well appointed. The location is extremely quiet yet it is only a few minutes walk to the Piazza San Marco. The only thing I was disappointed by was the breakfast. Now maybe it is just me because other reviewers seemed happy but I thought the breakfast room was cramped and uninviting (maybe it is different in the high season) and I thought the breakast was very ordinary and not 4 star standard. In fact on our last morning, we preferred to go out for breakfast. Overall though I thought the hotel was very good value for money and the room itself could not be faulted. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable”
Reviews.Author: Zoespapa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a GEM! Well appointed and not too large. No better place to stay in Venice if you ask me. Quite and charming. The continental breakfast was wonderful as well. Staff speak great English and make sure you want for nothing. I found this place online and everything was just as they portrayed. Stay here and you will Love it. You can thank me later:)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbug56Miami
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very quiet and clean. Delicious breakfast. Very helpful staff. My best choice for Venice if going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MeforLA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Codega exceeded my expectations in every way! The location was perfect, right between the Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's Square, nestled in a quiet and peaceful courtyard. It's not difficult to find if you stick to the map the hotel will e-mail you right before your visit - just remember it's the second little street behind the Burger King, there's a Georgio Armani store and your steps away! The rooms were very clean and decorated with style and charm. The breakfast room felt like a quaint, old world, tea room! The breakfast consist of croissants, fruit, yogurt, cold cuts, cheese, boiled eggs, coffee, juice and tea. They also have a separate lounge area next to the breakfast room which is simply stylish and charming. We loved everything about this hotel and would definately stay here again if ever in Venice. There's a really good coffee bar across from the Burger King that has the best Cafe Americano we had in all of Italy and we fell in love with their Frittelle Veneziane (a typical venetian pastry with pine nuts and raisins!). Overall, we can't wait to return to Hotel Al Codega!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the heart of Venice.”
Reviews.Author: wpn27
Reviews.Content: Al Codega is hidden away in a beautiful, small courtyard in the very heart of Venice, minutes away from St Marks Square. Though difficult to find initially, it proved to be an fabulous place to stay for our visit. We were on a family trip, and had three rooms between us. They were clean, comfortable and extremely well-appointed - excellent value for money. The staff were very friendly, and there was a comfortable lounge in which to sit and peruse various newspapers and magazines. The daily continental breakfast was outstanding, consisting of excellent fresh Italian produce. I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL IN THE MIDDLE OF THINGS”
Reviews.Author: CANATPL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located in a private courtyard between the Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's Square. The rooms are well appointed, clean, and comfortable. Ours was not large, but it was quality and the bathroom was done in beautiful dark marble. The breakfast was excellent, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The front desk was manned by Julie (from Iowa) and Salvatore. They were both very friendly and very helpful. I would not hesitate recommending this hotel to all my friends and family and the next time I am in Venice, I will be making a bee-line for the Hotel Al Codega.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: AdventureGirl73
Reviews.Content: Venice is a very expensive city and Al Codega is a beautiful hotel at a reasonable price. The rooms are charming and the staff very friendly. The hotel itself is a little difficult to find so be sure to get good directions. There is a little tunnel you have to find to get to the courtyard. We kept missing it. We loved the location, once found. It is right in the middle of great shopping and a short distance to St. Mark's Square. The secluded location is a real plus when it comes to noise, this hotel is VERY quiet. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: clancyaustin
Reviews.Content: overall, the hotel was great. It was VERY difficult to find. Everything is in Venice, but this particularly so, as it was in a courtyard that was unmarked. But we found the general vicinity and asked for directions. It was very cute, nice breakfast area (breakfast was okay) in a great location, and the staff was very helpful. The room was a good size, and very clean and comfy. maybe a little dated, but it seemed fitting for Venice - it could have just been the style, because nothing seemed worn or dirty. We would stay there again, if we didn't want to explore a different part of the city on our next trip. We only had about one day, and would have liked to spend a few more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Great City!”
Reviews.Author: amyhoop
Reviews.Content: we stayed for three days and had a great time, the hotels location is really central in san marco so literally 3 minutes to St Marks Square and approx. 4 minutes to Rialto, which is where we caught a boat from the airport quite easily, which cost 12 euros and takes approx. 40 mins, the hotel breakfasts were nice and all staff were helpful and all spoke good english. the Hotel rooms are also well equipped and comes with a free safe which we thought was great. all in all a great hotel in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “could easily be a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Theresa5678
Reviews.Content: excellent location; very clean; upscale accomodations; good breakfast - just a little hard to find

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: mhoney9
Reviews.Content: This is a small, pretty new and very clean hotel, tucked away in a quiet courtyard, but most convenient to all the sights. It has a delightful breakfast, friendly and helpful staff, computer access and more....a great spot for your Venice adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: imsoezgoin
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to the hype: Excellent: Location, bed, bathroom, decor, service and free continenetal breakfast. Nice quiet stay, the staff had very good restaurant recommendations. My only complaint is that the Wireless internet is not free (seriously, all hotels should provide this service for free). We would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: embandjhb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights post cruise here. We loved the location, in a small courtyard, in great walking distance for everything. Away from the noise and crowds of the the crowded Grand Canal area. The hotel has only 28 rooms. Our room was very small, but we booked the room knowing it was the "classic" double. Even tho it was crowded with our bags, it was full of beautiful furnishings, including Murano lighting fixtures, fabric walls, tv built into the mirror,beautiful updated bath..shower only. The breakfast was included in our very reasonable rate (for Venice) and was cold...fresh croissants and bread, fruit, cheese, meats, cereals, juice etc. Plenty to chose from. The staff was wonderful. With the windows open to our room, it was noisy with people walking by on a side road. But in the evening the windows blocked out the noise beautifully and we slept very well on the great mattress! We definitely enjoyed the atmosphere of the small sitting area and enjoyed the use of the computer for a minimal charge. Wonderful hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - close to everything - yet very quiet”
Reviews.Author: lruminski
Reviews.Content: Nice room; hotel located in a cute little courtyard - hard to find it initially - however everything in Venice is hard to find until you get your bearings; recommend printing the map the hotel sends you with your confirmation; have patience - you WILL get lost; good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “When in Venice there is only one hotel I would stay at ...Al Codega”
Reviews.Author: Dewingsue
Reviews.Content: We had a last minute change to this hotel as our hotel on the Grande Canal was fully booked. What a relief. This litte gem is tucked away in a beautiful courtyard within walking distance of the San Marco Piazza. The room overlooked the courtyard with three windows that opened outwards. I felt like I was in the country as it was so quiet without the hustle & bustle of Venice. The room was immaculately clean and tastefully decorated. The staff were always friendly and willing to assist. The breakfast was delightful and presented very tastefully. I am in the hotel industry and this boutique hotel is right up there with 5 star hotels. What a pleasure to have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Pants026
Reviews.Content: This place is an absolute gem. Nicely tucked away in a courtyard in the heart of the San Marco sestiere, the Al Codega has style, charm, friendly staff and is nicely appointed. Large rooms with air conditioning (a must for August in Italy!) and a good breakfast spread in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent location, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: LaurenPete
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an excellent location - right in the centre of everything and only a few minutes walk from San Marco (St Mark's Square). If you print off a Google map to walk to the area of the Hotel and then the map the hotel provides to find the exact location of the hotel then you should have no problem finding it. The staff were very friendly and helpful and our room was very clean. We were very impressed with the size of the room (there was a little hallway with a wardrobe and somewhere to put our bags) and the beautifully tiled bathroom. The room also had air conditioning which kept us nice and cool. The breakfast was lovely with alot of different things to choose from in the buffet including cereal, eggs and cake! This was one of the cheaper hotels in central Venice near San Marco which is why we chose it - however we thought it was a lovely hotel and excellent value for money. Tip - Make sure you go for a "Tourist Menu" when dining out - this will save you alot of money on the final bill!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mijinaLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean, nice rooms, air-conditioned, very conveniently located to San Marco Square, great free continental breakfast. I LOVED the location. The hotel is also very quite due to where it is located. Staff were friendly and helpful. Cons: The hotel was VERY hard to find. We were looking for our hotel for about 45 minutes on foot. It was a little frustrating. I would stay at this hotel again. Overall, our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in Venice's crown”
Reviews.Author: ddsmithLondon
Reviews.Content: There is not a lot more i can add-the hotel was perfect and made our 1st trip to Venice even more special-the Location was great and very central ,to be honest it took me 3 days to navigate my way round Venice anyhow! rooms were big, clean and quiet. The air conditioning was very welcome after a balmy day walking round Venice! Thank you to Julie on rececption who gave us lots of tips on resturants and things to do! All the staff were helpful and it amused us greatly that the lift always stopped at receptiion!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toronto23frank
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 wonderful nights in this lovely hotel. Great rooms & breakfast buffet with friendly heplful staff @ desk & @ breakfast. Would highly recomend & stay there again in a heartbeat. Excellent location @ centre of Venice but sure didn't feel like you were.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry, you'll find it easily enough”
Reviews.Author: Epictetus
Reviews.Content: After all the warnings about the difficulty of finding Al Codega, it turned out to not to be a real issue. Yes, the entrance is located in a courtyard not found on most maps, but the windows overlook the street "Goldoni" which is a major pathway from the Piazza San Marco to Rialto Bridge, with a lot of foot traffic. The courtyard is a box bounded by Goldoni, Fuseri, and Magazen. We used a private "motoscafo" water taxi from the airport, which offered an exciting and easy way to get to the "Testollini" dock which is just a block from the hotel on Goldoni. We actually walked up Goldoni a few steps past the alley that leads into the courtyard. We stopped at La Serenissima Hotel to ask the way and found that the back door of the Serenissima opens onto the courtyard of the Codega. The point is, once you find Goldoni or Campo San Luca, a small but well known piazza, you're just steps away; you just can't see the hotel entrance from the street. But don't worry, you'll find it, and once you do it's easy to re-find. The location is absolutely ideal. Like other reviewers, we found the hotel to be friendly, comfortable, clean, and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the main sites in Venice”
Reviews.Author: rjwalker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location for all the Venice main sites, 3 minutes walk from St Mark's square and 5 minutes from the Rialto bridge. The water bus from the airport stops at the Rialto which makes getting to the hotel easy. The exterior of the building is old but the inside appears to be almost brand new. The bedrooms are a good size and the shower was fantastic, plus the TV screen built into the mirror !!. As the hotel is in town there are no views from the rooms, also no kettle in the room. Clenliness in the hotel was of a high standard. Breakfat was very good with the usual range of meats, cheese, cereals, fruit, cakes etc but nothing hot. The staff were very friendly and helpful with queries and looking after our luggage on the last day. Check out time is a very reasonable noon. The hotel is located in a very secluded square, only one alleyway into it, so it can be difficult to find. The hotel sent me a map when I booked which I needed to follow closely.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely experince”
Reviews.Author: mickey173
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Al Codega from the 21st Dec for 2 nights - the hotel was clean and well kept - the staff were wonderful; very courteous and nothing was too much trouble! The hotel is in the middle of all the key attractions, but hidden away from the hustle and bustle - so it was lovely and quiet. Breakfast was served with little intrusion, the food was fresh and plentiful. The rooms were light and airy, comfortable and nicely presented - would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect....”
Reviews.Author: Jules081
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Al Codega for 5 nights at the beginning of December - we couldn't have asked for a better hotel. Having read previous reviews about problems finding the hotel we armed ourselves with plenty of maps, but it turned out that locating the hotel was pretty easy - having taken the alilaguna from the airport to San Marco (Giardini) we walked down Vallaresso to Fuseri, once you reach the Timberland shop turn right, and then take the second left, the hotel is straight ahead. If you reach Campo San Luca you've gone too far. Coming from the Rialto water bus stop is even easier, find the alley called Carbon, carry on straight into Campo San Luca, and the alley opposite is Fuseri. Getting around was very easy - St Mark's Basilica was literally 3 minutes walk away, as was Rialto Bridge - we walked to most parts of the city, using the VeniceCard Transport option to use the Water Buses when we wanted a break from walking. The staff at the hotel were very helpful - we were travelling only a few days after the floods, and the hotel were quick to respond to my email asking for advice on travelling to Venice at that time. As for the rooms, they were a good size, with a fantastic shower. Breakfast was ideal, a good selection of bread, cheese, meats, yoghurts, cereal and pastries. We also enjoyed drinks in the lounge area on a couple of evenings - there was a large selection of Venice travel guides which proved helpful. Overall, you couldn't ask more from a hotel, it provided everything we needed. Also, if you are lucky with the weather as we were, then I couldn't recommend travelling to Venice in the winter more - we could walk for ages before even seeing another person, it was lovely to walk around this fantastic place without crowds of people.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: maimurray
Reviews.Content: this is a great little hotel with lovely staff. Venice experienced severe flooding during my stay in the hotel and every staff member couldn't have been nicer or more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, perfect, clean & spot on location”
Reviews.Author: Mike66Harvey
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect!! Great location, very very clean and in my opinion great value for money. The rooms were great proportions although I stayed in a Deluxe room, not sure if the standard rooms are smaller and the bathrooms were very modern. The staff were very friendly and they were very helpful at reception. The hotel is located about 5 minutes from St Marks and 5 minutes from the Rialto Bridge, you couldn't ask for a more central spot. The only down side and it was only a minor niggle was the breakfast, albeit continental, could have been a little better. All I will say is that if you book here you will not be disappointed, but, make sure you have good directions before you arrive as it is located in a little courtyard which may be a little hard to find in the narrow streets.

Reviews.Title: “very good service, new and clean with a great location”
Reviews.Author: coalstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in May and later we confirmed a reservation of several rooms for our families -who were coming to our wedding in October. I would definitely recommend Al Codega for several reasons. Great location 5 minutes away from St. Mark's Square and Rialto Bridge, kind and professional service at the Reception desk (thank you for everything Salvatore), new and clean facilities, good breakfast and good price specially if you compare it to the average in Venice. I am very demanding regarding hotels, and I would definitely come back to this nice hotel in the most beautiful city.... Carol (Valencia)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but Some Internal Noise Issues”
Reviews.Author: SimonPaul
Reviews.Content: Everything other reviewers say about the location of this hotel and its quality is pretty accurate. It has a slightly quirky feel but is very well appointed and comfortable and a recommended choice for staying in Venice Two qualifications to that are necessary: 1. The breakfast was a little too restricted for a four star hotel. Little fresh fruit was on offer and there was no variety on a day by day basis. 2. Our room was near the lift shaft and other equipment areas which made the room noisy and it was impossible to sleep in when other guests stirred. Every word of the conversation in the next door room could be heard when standing in the shower and the noise of the man in the room next door urinating was unpleasant. Some attention to noise reduction is therefore required.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location in a tucked away courtyard”
Reviews.Author: LondonKymani
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Al Codega for three nights in September. The hotel is in a perfect location close to the Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square only five minutes walk away. The hotel is within a quiet courtyard, the rooms are small but sufficient as you really dont go to Venice to spend anytime in the hotel room, the rooms were clean, in venetian style, and had all the facilities you required. Our room had windows facing back out onto a busy street which was noisy when the windows were open however once closed and the shutters pulled over it was nice and quiet. The only problem is finding this hotel, we got lost a couple of times, the hotel is close to a small square with, unfortunately, a Burger King on it and the hotel is down a small street next to this but so many of these alleyways are similar it is easy to get lost, however I wouldnt be put off by this, it made it a challenge and it was worth it to find such a nice hotel in a central location but still tucked into a quiet courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, quite expensive”
Reviews.Author: MathiasR
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was alright. It was so close to everything that you could almost go to the hotel to use the bathroom while doing the city. It was also very clean and several times a day the bell boy was sweeping the courtyard.The breakfast was good and fresh and coffe and tea was served to the table. The people in the reception were helpful and booked some trips for us and tipped us about taking taking the boat to the airport from Rialto instead of San Marco. The only thing that could be considered bad was that the personnel kept cleaning our room and rearranging our clothes and shoes and organizing papers, books etc. They also, of course, made the bed and even put my PJs under the pillow but in the evening, every night, when we were out eating someone folded the out the sheets of the bed and put my pajamas on it. This is all alright but the personnel must have been in out room at least three times a day which seems a little too much. All in all the ambition of the personnel was good but so it should be considering we paid 755â‚¬ for three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: luvseurope6
Reviews.Content: Hotel Location - Close to everything! True it is hard to find the first time, but if you get close (Puma, Armani, Burger King or Hotel Serenissima) they can help. Staff - The most helpful I have encountered in my past trips to Italy. Room - Spotless! Quiet! Plenty spacious (knowing European hotel rooms, I always book a deluxe room). Bed was extremely comfortable. And the A/C works! We were there during an unusually hot September, and so glad to have nice A/C. Breakfast - I can't imagine having any more to choose from. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location fo san marco area”
Reviews.Author: stellarspacey
Reviews.Content: absolutely no complaints for this hotel. i agree that it is a little difficult to find, but if you look at the numbering system it didn't take long to find once we were in the area. very close to everything. if you plan to stay longer in Venice then a few days then i would recommend not staying so close to all the tourism and finding something closer to the other islands.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandJen
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is centrally based within a short walk of St Mark's Square. The room we stayed in was very luxurious and was a joy to come back to after long days walking around Venice! We had a large bed, plenty of wardrobe space, mini bar and a tv cunningly disguised as a mirror (took us a while to figure that one out!!) and air conditioning. All in all a great stay for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: thegoodwitch
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Al Codega and were very impressed. We had booked with Venere, who gave us 4% off the price. It wasn't cheap, but was good value considering the location and the quality. It was literally 5 minutes walk from both St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge which meant we could pop back to our room rather than look for a public toilet! The staff were helpful and spoke good English. We had emailed a couple of times with particular requests and they emailed back quickly. They sent us excellent directions and we found the place first time. When we were checking out they offered to look after our luggage till we had to leave the city. Breakfast was typical continental fare and there was plenty of it. I don't get why a previous reviewer thought the lack of a full English breakfast was an issue. If that's what people are looking for they should stay in England. Our room was spotless and had everything we needed. The bathroom was very modern with a tub and a shower and beautifully finished in marble. Our room looked out over a narrow street but we didn't notice any noise. We are early risers, however, so maybe those who like to have a lie-in would be better overlooking the courtyard which would be quieter. The windows had shutters as well as heavy curtains so it was nice and dark. I will stay here again if I ever go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeandlynne
Reviews.Content: We normally don't gush about hotels but would make an exception in this case as the Al Codega is an absolute gem. The staff treated us like we would hope to treat guests if we ran a hotel. They were friendly, helpful and always willing to help without being in your face about it. The rooms were beautifully appointed and very comfortable. Breakfast was relaxed and offered plenty of choice (continental choice which was ideal given the weather). We had abslutely no problems finding the hotel by following the directions sent to us by the hotel staff prior to the trip and the location was perfect, literally a couple of minutes walk from the Rialto and St Mark's. The hotel is very much in a boutique style and very stylish. We thought it was great value and we suspect that if it was located in a large city such as London or Paris you would really pay through the nose for it. When we go back to Venice in future we'll make it a priority to book at the Al Codega.

Reviews.Title: “Little Jewel”
Reviews.Author: DaisyDora
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice and a 3 day stay at Al Codega. The hotel is excellently located close to San Marco and is in a very quiet courtyard. The property itself is spotless and is fairly newly opened - just a couple of years. We had the junior suite which gave us extra room - in fact a twin bed was in there which could have been used for a child or a very good friend! The amenities of the room were very hi tech and modern - eg. the tv was hidden behind a mirror. the bathroom was beautiful with granite floor and counter top. The staff were very helpful at all times. We, too, were perpetually lost, the Armani store is another landmark to look for They tell us being lost is part of the charm of Venice!! We consider ourselves very lucky to have stumbled upon the Al Codega.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rob179
Reviews.Content: This hotel is currently ranked 29th out of all the hotels in Venice (on this website) - and for very good reason. We spent 3 nights here, and found it an ideal hotel for a Venice trip. The main problem as other people have said is finding it. With the map you're given it should be reasonably easy for you to get yourself to the square which has Burger King in it. Then take the alley to the right of Burger King, take the second (very small) alley on the left, Halfway along this is a covered alley - if you look up this, you will see the hotel. The difficulty in finding it, is that you look down small alleys and can't imagine it's the right way because they look so small. Once you've found it, we didn't struggle to find it again though. Put simply, the staff are great and very helpful - ask them anything about how to get to places etc and they will tell you. The hotel is very clean and fresh looking. The quality of the rooms is very good and they are well equipped - Best thing in the room was the shower! By far the best thing is the location - it's very quiet in a nice little square yet a few minutes walk to the two main attractions - Rialto and St Marks. This means that you are staying in a very comfortable hotel in the best possible location. Add to that the fact that I think compared to the rest of venice it's reasonably priced (we paid Â£450 for three nights) - but when you're paying Â£6 for a can of coke (in St Marks Sq) - hopefully that puts it in perspective! Downsides - well there were two minor ones for us. We felt the rooms were a little on the small side and we felt the breakfast was a bit naff - It's typically continental with all cold stuff, apart from warm croissants - so don't expect a full English because you won't get one! However these were minor issues but worth mentioning. All in all - definately one of the better hotels we have stayed in - and Location can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend it”
Reviews.Author: CoAntrimUlsterman
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the directions from a previous reviewer we found it with little difficulty, but on a 3 day stay we learned to recognise bewildered looking people with luggage in the S Luca square turning maps upside down as "Al Codega seekers" Hotel had all the good features mentioned by more reviewers, although I thought a few of the reviews were just a little over-enthusiastic. Very good but a bit pricey, but what in Venice isn't? Our stay was over a weekend, might be a bit cheaper mid week. To sum up -great location, and very comfortable. What more do you need for a few days in a place like Venice? Re dinner, go across the Rialto, turn left alomg R del Vin, and take 2nd street on right for Trattoria Madonna and great seafood. A popular place that doesn't do bookings so be ready to wait, but worth it. We went 2 nights out of our 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Why was the man in our room when we opened the door one afternoon?”
Reviews.Author: PickyTravellers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok in terms of room cleanliness, rooms are quite small as would be expected for a hotel in the main tourist area. It was very easy to find because the hotel had sent us an excellent map of how to get there from the station. The breakfast wasn't very good. Looked ok when I first saw it but didn't taste very good and the yoghurt was sour. Also we weren't too excited by the fact that we went back to the room one afternoon and before we knew it the man who sits at the front desk was in our room!!! We weren't even warned about this nor did he inform us why he was in our room. It was all too weird. I think there must be better hotels to stay in. Initially I was adamant on staying in the san marco area but after visiting there I think it is fine to stay a little further away. San Marco is way too touristy. Other areas where the vaparetto goes would have been better as they were less touristy.

Reviews.Title: “hard to find but worth the effort”
Reviews.Author: ratz
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days at the al codega.We were a little unsure having booked online but once we found it we knew we made the right choice. Right in the heart of the san marco district but hidden away and very quiet. The staff were excellent and the rooms are very new and clean. Was hard to find at night and with very little sleep when we arrived. We tried to ask for directions but no one seemed able to help find it. If you are going to this hotel just ask someone where the burgerking is. There is only 1 burgerking in venice and the hotel is pretty close to there.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Al Codega
HotelInfo.Address: Corte del Forno Vecchio - S. Marco 4435, 30124 Venice, Italy
